Description:
Provide accurate and reliable information on a timely manner to ensure success of audits in addition to compliance to accounting internal and external processes and standard.
Perform all work procedures in compliance with all relevant safety, health and environmental procedures to ensure a healthy and safe work environment.
Handle administration of collected employee information required for keeping records of actuals on overtime worked, annual leaves business related travels and the like to ensure clarity of audit trails and supporting information. 
Provide required assistance in setting Key Performance Indicators for accounts payable- and receivable-related duties.
Follow-up with customers/vendors on outstanding invoices and accurateness of recording respective transactions in accounting books and general ledgers on a weekly basis and assist in running standard aging reports.
Perform other job-related duties as assigned by the Controller.Skills
Skills:
External Audit
Budget Analysis.
Accounting Processes and Principles.
Treasury Management.
Financial Analysis.
Financial Information Systems.
Minimum Job Qualifications Requirement: Bachelor's degree in accounting, Finance, or equivalent.
Minimum Work Experience: Five (5) Years of related experience
